data.title: “Invisible War” Screening Followed by Director Q&A
data.meta_description: Dodge College hosts the screening of The Invisible War on Thursday, November 21, 2013 at 7:00 p.m. in the Folino Theater.   An investigative and powerfully emotional documentary about the epidemic of rape of soldiers within the US military, the institutions that perpetuate and cover up its existence, and its profound personal and social
data.meta_site_name: Dodge College of Film and Media Arts
data.text:
Dodge College hosts the screening of The Invisible War on Thursday, November 21, 2013 at 7:00 p.m. in the Folino Theater.

An investigative and powerfully emotional documentary about the epidemic of rape of soldiers within the US military, the institutions that perpetuate and cover up its existence, and its profound personal and social consequences.

A free screening of

The Invisible War

will be held Thursday, November 21, 2013 at 7 p.m. in Folino Theater. The screening will be followed by a Q & A with Oscar-nominated director Kirby Dick.

The Invisible War

is a groundbreaking investigation into one of America’s most disturbing secrets: the epidemic of rape within the US military. Focusing on the powerful stories of several young veterans, the film is a moving examination of the staggering personal and societal costs of these assaults.

Says Professor Sally Rubin of the film,

Everyone should go see Kirby Dick and “The Invisible War.” This is a groundbreaking film that has been hugely influential in changing policy around sexual assault in the military, and represents the highest potential of documentary films to create change.
